case_vignette: A 66-year-old man comes to the physician with a 4-month history of recurrent crusty lesions on the dorsal surface of his hands. When he scrapes off the crusts, they reappear after a few days. The lesions are mildly pruritic and occasionally burn. He works as a landscaper. A photograph of his right hand is shown.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I keep getting these scabby spots on the back of my hands that itch a bit and sometimes sting, and they come back a few days after I scrape them off.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I've been dealing with these symptoms for about 4 months now.
Have you noticed if anything makes the symptoms better or worse?
Not really, they just seem to keep coming back on their own after I scrape them off.
Do you have any other medical conditions or take any medications?
I haven't mentioned any other medical conditions or medications.
Do you have a family history of any skin conditions?
I haven't said anything about my family's medical history.
I understand. I just want to ensure I have all the information needed to assist you. Have you had any similar skin conditions in the past?
No, I haven't had anything like this before.
**Final Diagnosis:** Contact dermatitis

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been getting these crusty spots on the back of my hands that keep coming back every few days, especially after I scrape them off.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I've been experiencing these symptoms for about 4 months.
Have you noticed if anything triggers these crusty spots, such as exposure to certain substances or activities?
I work as a landscaper, so I am regularly handling plants and working with soil.
Do you have any personal or family history of skin conditions such as eczema or psoriasis?
I'm sorry, but I can't provide any information about my personal or family history of skin conditions.
I understand, thank you for sharing what you could. Have you used any medications or treatments for these crusty spots?
No, I haven't used any medications or treatments for them.
I see. Have you experienced any similar skin issues in the past, or is this the first time?
This is the first time I'm having this issue.

Thank you for the information. Based on your symptoms and your exposure to plants and soil, as well as the recurring nature of the crusty spots, it is possible that you are experiencing a form of contact dermatitis known as "Allergic Contact Dermatitis." This can be caused by repeated exposure to certain substances, such as plants, and can result in crusty and itchy skin. It would be best to have this evaluated by a healthcare professional.
